intro: Convolvulus strigulosus, commonly known as the woolly morning glory, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in the morning, giving it its common name. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous small, elongated seeds. Convolvulus strigulosus is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
